oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bill of sale for Mary, an enslaved girl, in Williamson County, Tennessee, from Joshua Reams to William Harrison, Jr., 1841 February 02
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A bill of sale from Williamson County, Tennessee, documenting the transfer of an enslaved girl slave named Mary from Joshua Reams to William Harrison, Jr. for the sum of three hundred and fifty dollars, dated Feb. 2, 1841. The verso of this document lists the subscribing witnesses, Daniel Baugh and Guilford Dudley, who appeared before Lemuel B. McConnico, clerk of the Williamson County Court and the Register's office on Feb. 6, 1841. Forms part of the Harrison House Collection. 1 document : b & w ; 11 x 19.5 cm.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Harrison, William, 1825-1889; Reams, Joshua; Baugh, Daniel; Dudley, Guilford, 1756-1833; Harrison family; Reams familiy; McConnico, Lemuel B.
Harrison House (Franklin, Tenn.)
